post_text:
Good evening, Tyger families!

This is orientation week for all students! Tomorrow, August 31, we will begin with a Teacher Work Day, dedicated to our educators to ensure they have the time to prepare classrooms and connect with families as we all begin a vast transition to an uncommon school year.

Last week, our staff and administrators began connecting with each other and preparing for the arrival of our students. They have been engaged in professional development, building lesson plans, assembling PPE materials and hanging signage. Many buildings hosted drive-thru meet and greets and school supply drop offs. Some families met their staff and teachers for the first time while others wereâ€¦

post_text:
Good evening, Tyger families!

Tomorrow, our teachers and staff will officially come back to their school buildings after a long five months since the COVID-19 pandemic closed our doors. There will be much work to do this week! Teachers, staff and administrators will be coming together, preparing classrooms, organizing, installing equipment, testing Tyger Digital Academy platforms, engaging in training and working together to determine the best ways to support and enhance learning. I am so grateful to work with people who believe in our district and our students. The work continues to ensure the highest quality of education and safety for all as we count down to the week of August 31.

We hadâ€¦

post_text:
Good evening, Tyger families!

Can you believe we are officially two weeks away from the start of the 2020-2021 school year? So many changes and unexpected turns have occurred since the closing of our school buildings due to COVID-19 on March 16. There has been much anticipation about the beginning of this school year and the time is finally here! School orientation begins with a staggered start the week of August 31.

This week, administrators will be meeting to determine which group -- Tygers or Falcons -- your student will be a part of. Families will receive this update no later than Monday, August 24.

ğŸ‘‰ Students in grades 7-12 can pick up their campus wear uniforms from Mansfield Seniorâ€¦

Is your student up to date on their immunizations? Students starting kindergarten, and those entering seventh and twelfth grades have required and recommended shots.

Beginning today, August 3, Richland County Public Health is taking appointments for immunizations! Call 419-774-4700 to schedule an appointment. Spots are filled Monday through Thursday, on a first come, first served basis. For more information, including what documents to bring, insurance options, mask requirements, visit the website https://tinyurl.com/yx8tbvdk. #HearUsRoar

There are so many reasons to ğŸ§¡ Mansfield City Schools. Matt Keasel, Director of Choirs, managed to narrow it down to five - read his reasons why!

ğŸ§¡ The staff and administration care about the students and EACH OTHER more than anywhere else I have worked.
ğŸ§¡ Mansfield Senior is focused on students succeeding in all possible areas of their lives. We're not just preparing them for college track, we're giving them an entire worldview to select from, and giving them the tools to make sure they are prepared when they achieve graduation.
ğŸ§¡ I am raising my family in this community, so it is doubly rewarding to play a part in its development.
ğŸ§¡ I am trusted to be creative and innovative in my teaching, and am confident I can try new things with students.

#HearUsRoar

post_text:
Today Thursday, July 2, Governor DeWine announced back to school health and safety guidelines for all school districts across Ohio. Mansfield City Schools is currently reviewing those guidelines.

Our school district has been planning and preparing for multiple scenarios to safely welcome students and staff back.

We will be reviewing the latest information from the governor so we can meet the requirements set forth in these guidelines. Once we know more, we will share more details. #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Good evening Tyger families! First, I have an important message regarding our second session of summer school. Registration for the second session of summer school will begin on Sunday, June 28 and conclude on Sunday, July 5 at 12:00 p.m. The second session of summer school will begin on July 6 and end on July 24.

This week we will move into the heart of the summer season as we celebrate the Fourth of July on Saturday. It will be a time of family gatherings and fireworks as we mark the birth of our nation. Unfortunately, it will be a weekend still clouded by the realities of COVID-19. Although news reports can be confusing it is obvious that the coronavirus will continue to impact us forâ€¦

Good evening Tyger families! Tomorrow, Monday, June 15, we will begin new student registration for all grades, pre-K through high school. Registration can be completed from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., Monday through Friday at the Raemelton Administration Building, 856 W. Cook Road.

Because of the lingering impact of COVID-19, we cannot say yet how the 2020-2021 school year will begin. Those decisions will be made in conjunction with health officials, the Governorâ€™s office and the Ohio Department of Education. Regardless, it is important to have an accurate count of our anticipated enrollment. If you have a child entering pre-K or have recently moved into the district, please register â’¶â“ˆâ’¶â“…. Ifâ€¦

post_text:
Good Evening Tyger Families! ğŸ¯ This school year is officially over! Once again, I want to thank our families and our entire school community for working with us to conclude the interrupted year successfully!

Now, our priority turns to how our schools might open in August. Last week, Governor DeWine said he wants to see students back in their classrooms. Our district leadership is working on three broad based outlines for August:

1. All students returning, in-person
2. Blended learning - students participate both in-person and remotely
3. All remote learning - virtual for all students, pre-K through 12th grade

We will continue to prepare our options for the upcoming school year. When we haveâ€¦
text:
Good Evening Tyger Families! ğŸ¯ This school year is officially over! Once again, I want to thank our families and our entire school community for working with us to conclude the interrupted year successfully!

Now, our priority turns to how our schools might open in August. Last week, Governor DeWine said he wants to see students back in their classrooms. Our district leadership is working on three broad based outlines for August:

1. All students returning, in-person
2. Blended learning - students participate both in-person and remotely
3. All remote learning - virtual for all students, pre-K through 12th grade

We will continue to prepare our options for the upcoming school year. When we haveâ€¦

post_text:
Good Evening Tyger families! Happy Motherâ€™s Day to all Tyger mothers! The love and respect we have for our mothers is a constant anchor whether in times of prosperity or turmoil.

Amidst the current turmoil caused by COVID-19, we remain hopeful to end the 2019-2020 school year successfully. Students in pre-k through eighth grade are working on their third at-home study packet. Mansfield Senior High students are completing lessons online. Well over 300 Chromebooks have been distributed to ensure students have access to complete their assignments.

This past week, we began recording high school graduates of the Class of 2020 for the modified in-person ceremony. This will continue through theâ€¦

Good Evening Tyger families! Happy Motherâ€™s Day to all Tyger mothers! The love and respect we have for our mothers is a constant anchor whether in times of prosperity or turmoil.

Good Evening Tyger Families! Two months ago, no one could have envisioned the impact COVID-19 would have on our immediate communities. The closing of our school buildings on March 16 has altered our school year in many ways. Our inability to hold a traditional in-person commencement ceremony is a tremendous loss to the Mansfield Senior High School Class of 2020, their families, district staff and the community at large.

As you may have read on the website, the Senior High staff has created a modified in-person ceremony while complying with all social distancing guidelines set by health officials and the Governor. While it doesnâ€™t replace the ceremony we desire, it is our very best effort toâ€¦

Good Evening Tyger Families! Tomorrow, April 27, we begin distribution of our third round of at-home lessons for students in pre-K through eighth grade. These packets will serve as instructional lessons for students through Friday, May 15. In addition, we will be distributing Chromebooks for Mansfield Senior High students, grades 9-12, to use for online instructional work that will be assigned. If you have any questions or concerns about picking up your studentsâ€™ packet, you may contact their school. For the complete packet and Chromebook pick up schedule visit, https://tinyurl.com/yddxzpf9.

Please also be sure to turn in previously completed packets at this time if you have not done soâ€¦

post_text:
**** Special Update ****

Per Governor Mike DeWineâ€™s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue with emergency remote learning for the remainder of the current academic year due to COVID-19.

We know there will be many questions as a result of this announcement; we are working quickly to address those, as well as identify alternative solutions for the impacts of this decision. In the meantime, we appreciate all of you for your ongoing support as we work through this together. We are in this together. #HearUsRoar #InThisTogetherOhio

post_text:
Good Evening Tyger Families! Tomorrow, April 20, we return to at-home lessons! We hope your break was relaxing and enjoyable! We continue to be committed to the education of our students through distance learning.

Although news reports can be confusing, there is some consensus that COVID-19 is leveling off. Though reports are encouraging, this does not mean a return to normalcy anytime soon. While we sort through daily changing reports, we must continue the task at hand to provide the best education possible through the at-home lessons prepared and sent home by teachers and staff.

This week, teachers will prepare a third set of at-home study packets. Soon, we will share pickup dates and time. Please understand that these lessons are not homework, but school work, to take the place of students being in their classrooms. It is vitally important that this work is completed and returned. Letâ€™s all work together, support each other and get the job done! #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Good evening Tygers! Spring break begins tomorrow, Monday April 13, and runs through Friday April 17. We will still distribute sack lunches and the next dayâ€™s breakfast from 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m. Monday through Friday at our three sites: Malabar Intermediate, Mansfield Senior High and Springmill STEM Elementary. Hundreds of meals are provided daily by our dedicated staff and committed volunteers to ensure that those who rely on school meals still have access to them.

While this COVID-19 time is unprecedented for us, letâ€™s remember our ancestors who survived the Spanish Flu of 1918 that infected an estimated â…“ of the worldâ€™s population as well as our oldest living generation who fought through World War II. Today, with the help of modern medicine, our nation once again resolves to ban together to overcome the novel coronavirus.

â€œWe donâ€™t develop courage by being happy everyday. We develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.â€ - Barbara De Angelis, New York Times bestselling author.

Be safe, strong and courageous Tyger Family! #HearUsRoar

post_text: Good Morning Tygers! As we move into another week of virtual learning, please know your concerns and questions are being considered. While we understand the importance of spring events like Senior Prom, Class Day and commencement, we are carefully considering health and safety precautions. While we weigh the outcomes of these events, we continue to focus on maximum academic achievement. Our staff and administration are meeting regularly and are doing all we can to make this last quarter of the school year impactful. Thank you for your continued support! #HearUsRoar

post_text:
***** Special Update *****

Per Governor Mike DeWineâ€™s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue remote learning through May 1, 2020 in response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. post_text:
UPDATE: 6:25 p.m. - Please visit https://tinyurl.com/rogrmax for additional information regarding this announcement.

Earlier today, March 12, 2020, Governor Mike DeWine announced all schools will be closed beginning at the end of the school day Monday, March 16, 2020 through Friday, April 3, 2020 due to COVID-19. We will share more information in regard to the impacts of this direction as soon as it is available. Thank you for your patience during this unpredictable time. #HearUsRoar
